page.title: 11THE LOCAL MP'S
page.content: On Tuesday 2nd May,1985,we had our County Election. The people who stood were SUSAN BLOW, for ALLIANCE, MIKE WEAVER, for LABOUR and ROBERT JAMES for CONSERVATIVES. In the 1980's our voting system is such that before the election every householder fills in a document about the residents in their home and this goes to make an electors register. Two weeks before the election the voter gets a card with the electoral number on it. On Polling day you get a polling slip from the polling clerk on which you put an 'X' for the person you want to vote for. The Polling Station was in the old village hall which has been there since the first world war. The result was that ROBERT JAMES was relected for a saet on the County Council for the Comberton Ward.
